elements.description:
### Usage Docked to its parent container (default):
Content
 #### Note: The parent container should be positioned (e.g. relative, absolute, or fixed; not static). Docked to the window:
Content
 Full configuration example: // Use this slot for the panel in its minimized state. // Write your own openPanel handler that calls .open() on the px-panel
// Use this slot for the main content of your panel in its opened state. // Write your own closePanel handler that calls .close() on the px-panel
// Other content with appropriate layout
### Styling Custom property | Description :------------ | :------------- `--px-panel-size` | Width (left/right) or height (top/bottom) of the panel `--px-panel-size--minimized` | Width (left/right) or height (top/bottom) of the panel when "minimized" `--px-panel-bg-color--light` | Background color for "light" panels `--px-panel-bg-color--medium` | Background color for "medium" panels `--px-panel-bg-color--dark` | Background color for "dark" panels `--px-panel-offset--top` | Offset for top of panel when "floating" `--px-panel-offset--right` | Offset for right side of panel when "floating" `--px-panel-offset--bottom` | Offset for bottom of panel when "floating" `--px-panel-offset--left` | Offset for left side of panel when "floating" `--px-panel-z-index` | Z-index of the panel - should be adjusted if multiple overlapping panels are possible

properties.name: _parentResizable
properties.description: The closest ancestor element that implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

properties.name: _notifyingDescendant
properties.description:
True if this element is currently notifying its descendant elements of
resize.

properties.name: stopKeyboardEventPropagation
properties.description:
If true, this property will cause the implementing element to
automatically stop propagation on any handled KeyboardEvents.

properties.name: _imperativeKeyBindings
properties.description: own properties of everything on the "prototype".

properties.name: position
properties.description: Where to place the panel - one of `top`, `bottom`, `left`, or `right`.

properties.name: opened
properties.description: Whether the panel is currently open (expanded).

properties.name: fixed
properties.description:
If set to true, the panel will have `position:fixed` so it will
be attached to the browser window instead of its parent container.

properties.name: persistent
properties.description:
If set to true, the panel will be opened and calls to the `close()` method will be ignored.
Mutating the `opened` property will still force a close of the panel.

properties.name: background
properties.description:
Whether to display the panel with a `light`, `medium`, or `dark` background.
These terms are relative, and can be used in conjunction with px-theme,
px-dark-theme, or your custom theme or CSS variables to toggle between 3 different
background colors.

properties.name: floating
properties.description:
If set to true, the panel will appear with an offset relative to the screen / container edges.
Can be overridden or customized using the CSS variables.

properties.name: minimizable
properties.description:
If set to true, the panel will not fully collapse when closed. It will appear in a minimized state.
You can use the content slot `minimized` to determine what will appear inside the panel while minimized
(likely an icon or button for fully opening the panel).

properties.name: _fullSize
properties.description:
Used internally to determine if the panel should display at full-width or full-height
for mobile responsiveness and space-constrained situations.

methods.name: notifyResize
methods.description:
Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
resizables of a resize change.

methods.name: assignParentResizable
methods.description:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

methods.name: stopResizeNotificationsFor
methods.description:
Used to remove a resizable descendant from the list of descendants
that should be notified of a resize change.

methods.name: resizerShouldNotify
methods.description:
This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element
params.description:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

methods.name: addOwnKeyBinding
methods.description:
Can be used to imperatively add a key binding to the implementing
element. This is the imperative equivalent of declaring a keybinding
in the `keyBindings` prototype property.

methods.name: removeOwnKeyBindings
methods.description: When called, will remove all imperatively-added key bindings.

methods.name: keyboardEventMatchesKeys
methods.description: Returns true if a keyboard event matches `eventString`.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the panel. Also called by iron-a11y-keys-behavior when a user presses the "Esc" key.

methods.name: _getContainerClasses
methods.description: Returns the appropriate classes based on the property values.

methods.name: _persistentChanged
methods.description: Sets the `opened` property for persistent panels.

methods.name: _handleResize
methods.description:
Called when an `iron-resize` event notifies the element that its
parent container size may have changed.

Size changed events will be collapsed to only trigger a new measurement
every 100ms. If the panel is currently hidden, measure events
will not be triggered.

methods.name: _measureAvailableWidth
methods.description: Determines whether the panel should be displayed fullSize for responsiveness.
